Posts.Content: EWS wrote: I am scheduled to begin chemo this Thursday--Carboplatin, Taxotere with Herceptin.  My oncologist advises chemo first before surgery.  I have one 2 cm. tumor and one 7mm tumor in the same breast.  I am anxious about getting started without a sentinel node biopsy first to determine lymph node involvement.  I've had a breast MRI, brain, bone, chest, pelvis scans, echo, etc.  Anyone else do things in this order instead?  As is, I'm to have six rounds of chemo--wait six weeks and then surgery.  I'm thinking double masectomy--any comments would be appreciated.  Thanks! Dx 11/26/2010, IDC, 2cm, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Chemo before surgery? EWS EWS

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2010 08:07PM EWS wrote: Thank you so much.  I am calling my oncologist in the morning.  I hate to put the brakes on starting chemo this week, but I sure would like to have the sentinel node biopsy to know exactly what we're dealing with.
Posts.Title: Chemo before surgery? EWS EWS
